properties.label: Route I — Indian Ocean → Atlantic Labor Circuits
properties.echo: This route traces the movement of South Asian people into Atlantic worlds through empire, maritime labor, coercion, and post-abolition indenture. While distinct from African chattel slavery, these labor systems were designed to replace it—binding Indian bodies to the same plantations, ports, and profits built by the transatlantic slave trade.

properties.label: Route II — West Africa → Caribbean
properties.echo: Extraction routes: wealth for empires, catastrophe for communities—memory carried across saltwater.

properties.label: Route III — Mississippi → Chicago
properties.echo: The Great Migration: leaving the plantation economy, building northern cities, remaking culture and politics.

properties.label: Route IV — Maroon Corridor (Swamps & Bayous)
properties.echo: Refusal routes: maroon survival in wetlands—kinship, camouflage, and self-determination.
